# Google Calendar

### Objectives
At the end you will know how to:
1. Understand what Google Calendar is used for.
2. Schedule events.
3. Add reminders.
4. Share and view.
5. Create a team calendar.

## What is Google Calendar?

Google Calendar is a time-management and scheduling calendar service developed by Google. It allows user to quickly schedule meetings and events, and get reminders about upcoming activities.
Google Calendar is designed for teams, so itâ€™s easy to share your schedule with others and create multiple calendars that you and your team can use together.

## Getting Started

You can access Google calendar by searching "Google Calendar" on Google.com or by clicking on the start menu located on the lower left hand corner and searching for "Google Calendar".

This is what it should look like when "Google Calendar" is typed in Google.com.

![Result from searching "Google Calendar" in Google.com](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26696913/662fe760-46de-11e7-993f-38dc2c5474b2.png)

This is what it should look like when searching "Google Calendar" in the start menu.

![Searching "Google Calendar" in Start Menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26697215/32db7c52-46df-11e7-80fb-e3736e6739be.png)

Both options should lead to a screen similar to this.

![Google Calendar screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26698856/85c6102a-46e5-11e7-80e7-bfe2b62f5e6c.png)

## Schedule events
Start by clicking on the "Create" button.

![Create button](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26749773/d7fe7ad0-47df-11e7-854f-b1c6fa6e5a5f.png)

After pressing the "Create" button a new page will be loaded where you can name the event, assign the event start time and end time and date, location, description, and additional customizable features. After inputting all the information the event can be created by pressing the "Save" button at the top.

![Event settings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26749822/744b8008-47e1-11e7-89e1-cf5524f4eb07.png)

## Adding reminders
After creating the event you can click on the event in the calendar and press the "Edit event" button as shown below.

![Pressing on calendar event](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26750070/b84c39ea-47e7-11e7-8494-cd11c9ae0bd3.png)

In the notification section, choose how you want to be reminded about the event and add multiple notifications by clicking on "Add Notification" and remove a notification by clicking on the "x" sign next to the notification you want to remove.

![Notification section](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26750117/bf0e613a-47e8-11e7-9156-d7961fe9118c.png)

## Share and View
You can share your calendar with other people by clicking on the down arrow next to the calendar you want to share.

![Sharing calendar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26750143/9d14762c-47e9-11e7-9e02-96274a374b2d.png)

After pressing the share button a new screen will appear where you can add people by their emails. After selecting the various settings and adding all users you want to share the calendar the top save button can be pressed.

![Share settings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26750154/e0b82b44-47e9-11e7-8a33-c56a09474418.png)

## Create a team calendar
Start by clicking on the down arrow next to "My Calendars" and select "Create new calendar".

![Create new calendar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26750200/fc1984f4-47ea-11e7-8283-98177e7d2ee0.png)

### Edit team calendar
1. A new screen will show up where you can inpute the name of the calendar, timezone, and a description so your team knows the purpose of the calendar. 
2. Check the "Share this calendar with other" box, and share it with everyone in your team.
3. You can also enter the emails of individuals who can modify or manage the calendar, and set their permission levels.
4. Click "Create calendar".

![Editing calendar settings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19320775/26750257/ded990a4-47eb-11e7-89a4-d20755e611a3.png)
